name: Chris Guzman
body:
***
## About me
Towson U graduate. Nonprofit professional. Currently enrolled in the [Back-End Web Dev (BEWD) course at Betamore Academy](www.betamore.com/academy/back-end-web-development/).
***

## What we covered in BEWD's first class
###### 2/13/14
Paul showed us how he sets up his dev environment which includes:

* [Sublime Text 3](www.sublimetext.com/3)
* [iTerm (terminal replacement)](iterm2.com)
* [Homebrew](brew.sh)
* [Xcode](https://developer.apple.com/xcode/)
  * Note: I had to troubleshoot homebrew and xcode on my own. Which was a learning experience I definitely recommend to everyone. It prepares you for the future and is so much more satisfying when you find the solution.
* [Alfred (spotlight replacement)](alfredapp.com)
* Git and github

The general layout of the course will be a flipped classroom. We will go over lessons outside of class and then code in class with our mentor. So they definitely encourage learning on your own.

I plan on learning more ruby on my own with [code school](codeschool.com) and [Learn Ruby The Hard Way](ruby.learncodethehardway.org).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
